channel.title: Black Mesa Source's Engine and Dev Time
channel.description:
I'm just gonna put this out there:
Half-Life 2 is now older than Half-Life was when Half-Life source came out.
Doesn't that defeat the point? If Black Mesa Source isn't released soon, shouldn't it at least use a newer version of Source?

item.title: Black Mesa Source's Engine and Dev Time
item.dc:creator: CB1993
item.description:
Raminator:

We’re using the most up-to-date version of Source available to us. We can’t compile the game under Source 2009 (it’s not as fully functional as Source 2007), and the Portal 2 version of Source isn’t available to mod teams.

Actually, the Alien Swarm engine is newest available version of source.

Read full topic
item.source: Black Mesa Source's Engine and Dev Time

item.title: Black Mesa Source's Engine and Dev Time
item.dc:creator: CygNuS
item.description:
Ramirezoid:

It’s 2011. Nobody likes image macros anymore. You can stop any time.

No adults (or very few) used to like My Little Pony in the 90’s and look where that brought us in 2011.

I can’t wait until it’s again cool to have signature pics which are at least 8000px in height.

I’m actually from Sydney, I moved up to Newcastle earlier this year for work.

burst my bubble next time. i feel hurt.

item.title: Black Mesa Source's Engine and Dev Time
item.dc:creator: reaxion
item.description:
xalener:

he found a pic he found amusing and bent over backwards trying to find an excuse to use it.

I’ve been guilty of doing it before.

Actually, no. I came up with the spoons thing (fan of The Tick, and all that) and went hunting for a pic that suited

Found some really really bizarre spoon pics… some cannot be unseen.

item.title: Black Mesa Source's Engine and Dev Time
item.dc:creator: FERGUS
item.description:
I see that your avatar is the Pillar of Autumn…

Regarding your question, No. The Dev team has stated that they won’t update to a newer version of the engine, but if they would, it would certainly add 1-3 years of developing.

Read full topic
